Supply chain that seemed to be interrupted have been partially recovered and the production and processing process also started to return to â€œa new normalâ€. However, the reality reveals that many negative impacts of the pandemic still exist, directly affecting the supply chain, especially the global food supply chain. Many changes have taken place in the food operation and supply process, but consumers' concerns about food quality and origin have never changed, even increased.
